Speculum is lubricated and gently inserted into the vagina by initially directing it dorsally and then cranially.
Exam vestibule and vagina.
Flexible or rigid endoscopes are gently inserted into the vagina by vinitially directing it dorsally and then cranially. (If dogs are aggressive or sensitive, general anesthesia can be needed)
Exam the reproductive tract.
Part the lips of the vulva and gently insert a swab at a relatively steep angle
After 1-2 inches of the swab have been inserted, the angle of insertion can be altered to roughly 45 degree and insertion continued
When the swab is fully inserted, rotate the end through 2-3 revolutions, which will allow the cotton tip to pick up an adequate load of cells
The swab can then be withdrawn, and smear on glass slide
Examine the slide
Initially, the dog's penis is vigorously massaged through the prepuce at the level of the bulbus glandis until a partial erection develops.
The prepuce is quickly retracted caudally (pushed back) past the bulbus glandis.
Firm constant pressure is applied to the penis behind the bulbus glandis by squeezing the penis between index finger and thumb.
Examine semen by microscope or CASA.
